org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.partition

类 SpillableSubpartition

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.partition.ResultSubpartition
      • org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.partition.SpillableSubpartition

  • class SpillableSubpartition
extends ResultSubpartition
    A spillable sub partition starts out in-memory and spills to disk if asked to do so.

    Buffers for the partition come from a BufferPool. The buffer pool is also responsible to trigger the release of the buffers if it needs them back. At this point, the spillable sub partition will write all in-memory buffers to disk. All added buffers after that point directly go to disk.

    This partition type is used for ResultPartitionType.BLOCKING results that are fully produced before they can be consumed. At the point when they are consumed, the buffers are (i) all in-memory, (ii) currently being spilled to disk, or (iii) completely spilled to disk. Depending on this state, different reader variants are returned (see SpillableSubpartitionView and SpilledSubpartitionView).

    Since the network buffer pool size for outgoing partitions is usually quite small, e.g. via the TaskManagerOptions.NETWORK_BUFFERS_PER_CHANNEL and TaskManagerOptions.NETWORK_EXTRA_BUFFERS_PER_GATE parameters for bounded channels or from the default values of TaskManagerOptions.NETWORK_BUFFERS_MEMORY_FRACTION, TaskManagerOptions.NETWORK_BUFFERS_MEMORY_MIN, and TaskManagerOptions.NETWORK_BUFFERS_MEMORY_MAX, most spillable partitions will be spilled for real-world data sets.

      字段 
      限定符和类型 字段和说明
      private java.util.ArrayDeque<Buffer> buffers
      Buffers are kept in this queue as long as we weren't ask to release any.

      The I/O manager used for spilling buffers to disk.

      Flag indicating whether the subpartition has been finished.

      Flag indicating whether the subpartition has been released.

      The read view to consume this subpartition.

      The writer used for spilling.

        private final java.util.ArrayDeque<Buffer> buffers
        Buffers are kept in this queue as long as we weren't ask to release any.

      • ioManager

        private final IOManager ioManager
        The I/O manager used for spilling buffers to disk.

      • spillWriter

        private BufferFileWriter spillWriter
        The writer used for spilling. As long as this is null, we are in-memory.

        Flag indicating whether the subpartition has been finished.
